title: Binance Employees Find $1.7 Billion in Crypto Was Sent to Iranian Entities
summary: Binance pledged to crack down on crime. But internal investigators at the world’s largest crypto exchange continued to find evidence of potential legal violations on the platform.

title: Drug Lord ‘El Mencho’ Was Killed in Mexico. What’s Next for the Cartel He Led?
summary: The death of Nemesio Oseguera Cervantes dealt a major blow to the Jalisco New Generation Cartel, but few believe it spells the end for the powerful group.

title: What to Know About the Killing of ‘El Mencho’
summary: The Mexican government has killed Nemesio Oseguera Cervantes, the longtime leader of one of Mexico’s most powerful gangs, the Jalisco New Generation Cartel.

title: Witness Who Disputed ICE Account of Ruben Ray Martinez Shooting Dies in Car Accident
summary: A passenger in the car with Ruben Ray Martinez wrote that the men were trying to comply with authorities before Mr. Martinez was shot. The passenger, Joshua Orta, died in a car accident on Saturday.

title: Border Patrol Shoots Armed Person Near Canadian Border, Authorities Say
summary: The F.B.I. said that the person, who was not killed, “allegedly fired at” a Border Patrol agent in Pittsburg, N.H., around 1 a.m. on Sunday.

title: Pizzoccheri Was Prominent at Winter Olympics in Italy
summary: Pizzoccheri, a hearty buckwheat pasta, graced restaurant menus and the athletes’ cafeterias. A chef hopes it can put a spotlight on the valley where it comes from.

title: The European Union Hits Pause on Its U.S. Trade Deal
summary: The E.U. isn’t throwing out the deal it agreed with the United States before President Trump’s tariffs were overruled, but European officials want more clarity first.

title: Why the Supreme Court Struck Down Trump’s Tariffs
summary: Our reporter Ann E. Marimow describes the rationale of the Supreme Court’s 6-to-3 ruling to strike down President Trump’s sweeping tariffs.

title: Trump’s Challenge to Free Market Capitalism
summary: Stakes in private companies. Handshake deals with chief executives. The president’s economic policy has drifted far from principles that long defined the Republican Party. Is it capitalism at all?

title: Trump Administration Scrambles to Pick Up the Pieces of Broken Tariffs
summary: President Trump is already working to piece his tariff program back together, after a Supreme Court ruling ruptured a centerpiece of his economic agenda.

title: What’s Happened Since the Supreme Court’s Tariff Ruling
summary: After the Trump administration’s punishing tariffs were invalidated, the president said he would impose new tariffs using a different authority. It’s been a whirlwind.

title: Judge Bars Release of Special Counsel Report on Trump’s Mishandling of Documents
summary: Judge Aileen Cannon, a Trump-appointed federal judge in Florida, slammed the former special counsel, Jack Smith, for drafting the report even after she had dismissed the case.

title: Fact-Check: Trump’s Latest Claims on Jobs, Inflation and Crime
summary: Trends on jobs, inflation and crime that began before Donald Trump retook office continued, largely unabated, in his first year back.

title: Trump Says He Brought Down Inflation, Yet Many Still Feel the Pinch
summary: President Trump says that he has brought down inflation, but families are still struggling to pay bills and plan for the future.

title: Judges Grow Angry Over Trump Administration Violating Their Orders
summary: At least 35 times since August, federal judges have ordered the administration to explain why it should not be punished for violating their orders in immigration cases.

title: U.K. Police Arrest Ex-Ambassador Peter Mandelson Amid Epstein Accusations
summary: Peter Mandelson is being investigated over accusations of “misconduct in public office” amid his dealings with Jeffrey Epstein, the sex offender.

title: Architecture Prize Responds After Tom Pritzker’s Epstein Ties Surface
summary: A Pritzker Prize statement cited the award’s independence after Mr. Pritzker, who directs the foundation behind the award, resigned as chairman of the Hyatt Corporation.

title: ‘Survivor’ Is America
summary: It’s our greatest game and our truest mirror. And in its tiki-torch-festooned way, it’s captured our society as an ever-changing collection of tribes.

title: For Iran’s Rulers, Refusing U.S. Demands Is a Risk Worth Taking
summary: The government in Tehran sees capitulating to Washington’s demands on uranium enrichment and ballistic missiles as riskier to its survival than going to war, analysts say.

title: The Next Conflict
summary: We’re looking at the potential for a U.S. attack on Iran.

title: Backed by Anthropic, a Super PAC Group Begins an Ad Blitz in Support of A.I. Regulation
summary: The ads by Public First Action, which started airing on Monday, are part of an escalating political war over artificial intelligence before the midterm elections.

title: Supreme Court to Weigh Oil-Industry Effort to End a Major Climate Suit
summary: The case could have significant bearing on a range of other lawsuits brought against the fossil fuel industry by cities and states across the country.

title: Supreme Court Considers Fate of Docks and Other Assets Seized by Cuba in 1960
summary: Amid rising tensions with Cuba, the Trump administration is backing lawsuits that would allow Americans to get compensation for property confiscated by Fidel Castro’s regime.

title: The Zero Units Fought for the C.I.A. in Afghanistan. In the U.S., They’re Living in Fear.
summary: A shooting in Washington, D.C., threw their immigration status into jeopardy — and brought attention to a long-hidden dimension of America’s war.

title: BAFTAs Guest With Tourettes Shouts Racial Slur During Michael B. Jordan and Delroy Lindo’s Appearance
summary: A racist slur, shouted involuntarily while Michael B. Jordan and Delroy Lindo were presenting an award, raised questions about how the show’s host and the BBC responded.

title: BAFTAs 2026: The Best and Worst Moments
summary: Alan Cumming forced fishy British snacks onto movie stars. Paddington Bear presented an award. And a racist slur and swearing.

title: Prince William and Kate Made a Pointed Appearance at BAFTA
summary: After Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor’s arrest, the Prince and Princess of Wales made a pointed BAFTA appearance.

title: The Human Cost of the Trump Administration’s War on Science
summary: The ripple effects of cutting H.I.V. research funding.

title: What We Don’t Understand About Nick Reiner
summary: We feel compassion for his parents — but often not for Nick Reiner himself. His suffering, too, must have been terrible; it must be terrible right now.

title: Nick Reiner Pleads Not Guilty in the Killing of His Parents
summary: Mr. Reiner, 32, was charged with murdering his parents, the Hollywood director Rob Reiner and Michele Singer Reiner, last year.

title: The Ukrainian Bureaucrat Working to Squeeze Russia’s War Machine
summary: Vladyslav Vlasiuk has spent the past four years pressing Western allies to squeeze the Russian economy through more sanctions. He hopes that 2026 will be the tipping point.

title: France Summons U.S. Ambassador Over Comments on Activist’s Killing
summary: Charles Kushner, President Trump’s envoy to Paris, was called in after the State Department cited “violent radical leftism” in the beating death of Quentin Deranque, 23.

title: Democrats Consider Breaking a Taboo in Washington State: A Millionaires Tax
summary: The state where Jeff Bezos and Bill Gates made fortunes might have progressive social policies, but its resistance to an income tax is similar to conservative states. That might change.
